Provision.Text: Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Industry, pursuant to sections 65a, 65.1b and 65.2c of the Trademarks Actd, makes the annexed Trademarks Regulations.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in these Regulations.

Definition.Text: Act means the Trademarks Act. (Loi)
associate trademark agent means a trademark agent who is appointed by another trademark agent under subsection 22(2). (agent de marques de commerce associé)
International Bureau means the International Bureau of the World Intellectual Property Organization. (Bureau international)
International Register means the official collection of data concerning international registrations that is maintained by the International Bureau. (Registre international)
international registration means a registration of a trademark that is on the International Register. (enregistrement international)
trademark agent means a trademark agent as defined in section 2 of the College of Patent Agents and Trademark Agents Act. (agent de marques de commerce)

Section.Text: Unless otherwise indicated, a reference to a period in these Regulations is to be read, if the period is extended under section 47 or 47.1 or subsection 66(1) of the Act, as a reference to the period as extended.
Written communications intended for the Registrar must be addressed to the “Registrar of Trademarks” and include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case that the communication is submitted by a trademark agent, the name of that agent and, if all the trademark agents at the same firm are appointed in respect of the business to which the communication relates, the name of that firm; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, the name of the person submitting the communication.

Subsection.Text: A written communication intended for the Registrar must not relate to more than one application for the registration of a trademark or more than one registered trademark.
Subsection (1) does not apply to a written communication in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a change of name or address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a payment of a fee for the renewal of a registration;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a cancellation of a registration;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a transfer of a registered trademark or of an application for the registration of a trademark;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a document affecting rights in respect of a registered trademark or of an application for the registration of a trademark;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: an appointment or revocation of an appointment of a trademark agent;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a correction of an error; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the provision of evidence, written representations, requests for a hearing or requests for the award of costs in a proceeding under section 11.13, 38 or 45 of the Act.

Section.MarginalNote: Written communications regarding applications for registration

Subsection.Text: A written communication intended for the Registrar in respect of an application for the registration of a trademark must include the name of the applicant and, if known, the application number.

A written communication intended for the Registrar in respect of a registered trademark must include the name of the registered owner and either the registration number or the number of the application that resulted in the registration.
Joint applicants, opponents and objectors must provide a single postal address for correspondence.
A person that is doing business before the Office of the Registrar of Trademarks must notify the Registrar of any change of their postal address for correspondence.

Section.Text: The Registrar is not required to have regard to any communication that is not submitted in writing, other than a communication made during a hearing held in a proceeding under section 11.13, 38 or 45 of the Act.
A document that is provided to the Registrar must be clear, legible and capable of being reproduced.

The Registrar is not required to have regard to the whole or any part of a document that is provided in a language other than English or French unless a translation into English or French is also provided.

Section.MarginalNote: Manner of providing documents, information or fees

Subsection.Text: Unless provided by an electronic means in accordance with subsection 64(1) of the Act, documents, information or fees must be provided to the Registrar by physical delivery to the Office of the Registrar of Trademarks or to an establishment that is designated by the Registrar as being accepted for that purpose.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Date of receipt — physical delivery to Office
Subsection.Text: Documents, information or fees that are provided to the Registrar by physical delivery to the Office of the Registrar of Trademarks are deemed to have been received by the Registrar

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if they are delivered when the Office is open to the public, on the day on which they are delivered to the Office; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if they are delivered when the Office is closed to the public, on the first day on which the Office is next open to the public.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Date of receipt — physical delivery to designated establishment
Subsection.Text: Documents, information or fees that are provided to the Registrar by physical delivery to a designated establishment are deemed to have been received by the Registrar

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if they are delivered when the establishment is open to the public,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case where the Office of the Registrar of Trademarks is open to the public for all or part of the day on which they are delivered, on that day, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in any other case, on the day on which the Office of the Registrar of Trademarks is next open to the public; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if they are delivered when the establishment is closed to the public, on the first day on which the Office of the Registrar of Trademarks is next open to the public that falls on or after the day on which the establishment is next open to the public.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Date of receipt — provision by electronic means
Subsection.Text: Documents, information or fees that are provided to the Registrar by an electronic means in accordance with subsection 64(1) of the Act are deemed to have been received on the day, according to the local time of the place where the Office of the Registrar of Trademarks is located, on which the Office receives it.
Subsections (1) to (3) do not apply in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an application for international registration referred to in sections 98 to 100;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a request for the recording of a change in ownership referred to in sections 101 and 102;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a request for division referred to in section 123; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a transformation application referred to in section 147.

Subsection.Text: Subsections (1) to (4) do not apply in respect of documents, information or fees that are provided to the Registrar by the International Bureau.

Section.Text: The Registrar may waive the payment of a fee if the Registrar is satisfied that the circumstances justify it.
On request made no later than three years after the day on which a fee is paid, the Registrar must refund any overpayment of the fee.

Subsection.Text: A person that provides the Registrar with a copy of an affidavit or statutory declaration in a matter in respect of which an appeal lies under subsection 56(1) of the Act must retain the original for a retention period that ends one year after the day on which the applicable appeal period expires but, if an appeal is taken, ends on the day on which the final judgment is given in the appeal.
On request by the Registrar made before the end of the retention period, the person must provide the original to the Registrar.

Section.Text: A person that applies for an extension of time under section 47 of the Act must pay the fee set out in item 1 of the schedule to these Regulations.

Section.MarginalNote: Prescribed days — extension of time periods
Section.Text: The following days are prescribed for the purpose of subsection 66(1) of the Act:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: Saturday;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: Sunday;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: January 1 or, if January 1 falls on a Saturday or Sunday, the following Monday;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: Good Friday;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: Easter Monday;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the Monday before May 25;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: June 24 or, if June 24 falls on a Saturday or Sunday, the following Monday;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: July 1 or, if July 1 falls on a Saturday or Sunday, the following Monday;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the first Monday in August;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the first Monday in September;

Paragraph.Label: (j.1)
Paragraph.Text: September 30 or, if September 30 falls on a Saturday or Sunday, the following Monday;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the second Monday in October;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: November 11 or, if November 11 falls on a Saturday or Sunday, the following Monday;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: December 25 and 26 or

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if December 25 falls on a Friday, that Friday and the following Monday, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if December 25 falls on a Saturday or Sunday, the following Monday and Tuesday; and

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: any day on which the Office of the Registrar of Trademarks is closed to the public for all or part of that day during ordinary business hours.

Subsection.Text: An applicant, registered owner or other person, may appoint one trademark agent or all the trademark agents at the same firm to represent them in any business before the Office of the Registrar of Trademarks.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Power to appoint associate trademark agent
Subsection.Text: A trademark agent, other than an associate trademark agent may, in turn, appoint one trademark agent or all the trademark agents at the same firm as an associate trademark agent to represent the person that appointed them in any business before the Office of the Registrar of Trademarks.
The appointment of one trademark agent is effective on the day on which the Registrar receives an appointment notice that includes the name and postal address of the trademark agent.
The appointment of all the trademark agents at the same firm is effective on the day on which the Registrar receives an appointment notice that includes the name and postal address of the firm.
The revocation of the appointment of one trademark agent or all the trademark agents at the same firm is effective on the day on which the Registrar receives a notice to that effect.

Section.Text: If all the trademark agents at the same firm have been appointed, the following rules apply:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a trademark agent who becomes a member of that firm after the appointment is deemed to be appointed on the day on which they become a member of the firm;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a person who is a member of that firm who becomes a trademark agent after the appointment is deemed to be appointed on the day on which they become a trademark agent;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the appointment of a trademark agent who ceases to be a member of that firm is deemed to be revoked on the day on which they cease to be a member of the firm; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the appointment of a trademark agent whose licence is suspended, revoked or surrendered is deemed to be revoked on the day on which their licence is suspended, revoked, or surrendered.

Section.Text: If all the trademark agents at the same firm have been appointed, any written communication sent by the Registrar to the firm is considered to have been sent to all of the trademark agents at the firm.

Section.MarginalNote: Acts done by or in relation to trademark agent

Subsection.Text: In any business before the Office of the Registrar of Trademarks, any act done by or in relation to a trademark agent, other than an associate trademark agent, has the same effect as an act done by or in relation to the person that appointed them in respect of that business.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Acts done by or in relation to associate trademark agent
Subsection.Text: In any business before the Office of the Registrar of Trademarks, any act done by or in relation to an associate trademark agent has the same effect as an act done by or in relation to the person that appointed, in respect of that business, the trademark agent who, in turn, appointed the associate trademark agent.
Subject to subsection (4), in any business before the Office of the Registrar of Trademarks, a person may be represented by another person only if that other person is a trademark agent.
Subject to subsections (3) and (4), in any business before the Office of the Registrar of Trademarks in respect of which a person has appointed a trademark agent

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person must not represent themselves; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: no one other than the trademark agent, or an associate trademark agent appointed by that trademark agent, is permitted to represent that person.

Subsection.Text: A person may represent themselves for the purpose of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: filing an application for the registration of a trademark, an application for international registration referred to in sections 98 to 100 or a transformation application referred to in section 147;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: paying a fee;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: giving notice under section 23;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: renewing the registration of a trademark under section 46 of the Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: making a request or providing evidence under section 48 of the Act.

Subsection.Text: With respect to any business referred to in paragraphs (3)(a) to (e), a person may be represented by another person authorized by them, whether or not that other person is a trademark agent or an individual whose name is included in the Register of Trademark Agents under section 20 of the College of Patent Agents and Trademark Agents Regulations.

Section.Text: Any person or entity that requests the giving of public notice under paragraph 9(1)(n) or (n.1) of the Act must pay the fee set out in item 4 of the schedule to these Regulations.

For the purpose of subsection 9(4) of the Act, the fee to be paid by a person who requests that public notice be given under that subsection is the fee set out in item 5 of the schedule to these Regulations.
Any person, firm or other entity that requests the protection of a geographical indication must pay the fee set out in item 6 of the schedule to these Regulations.
A separate application must be filed for the registration of each trademark.
An application for the registration of a trademark, with the exception of the trademark itself, must be in English or French.

Section.MarginalNote: Manner of describing goods or services
Section.Text: The statement of the goods or services referred to in paragraph 30(2)(a) of the Act must describe each of those goods or services in a manner that identifies a specific good or service.
The following requirements are prescribed for the purpose of paragraph 30(2)(c) of the Act:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a representation may contain more than one view of the trademark only if the multiple views are necessary for the trademark to be clearly defined;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a two-dimensional representation must not exceed 8 cm by 8 cm;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the trademark consists in whole or in part of a three-dimensional shape, a representation must be a two-dimensional graphic or photographic representation;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if colour is claimed as a feature of the trademark or if the trademark consists exclusively of a single colour or a combination of colours without delineated contours, a visual representation must be in colour;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if colour is not claimed as a feature of the trademark or if the trademark does not consist exclusively of a single colour or a combination of colours without delineated contours, a visual representation must be in black and white;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if the trademark consists in whole or in part of a sound, a representation must include a recording of the sound in a format that is designated by the Registrar as being accepted for that purpose; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a description must be clear and concise.

Section.Text: The following information and statements are prescribed for the purpose of paragraph 30(2)(d) of the Act:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant’s name and postal address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the trademark consists in whole or in part of characters other than Latin characters, a transliteration of those other characters into Latin characters following the phonetics of the language of the application;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the trademark consists in whole or in part of numerals other than Arabic or Roman numerals, a transliteration of those other numerals into Arabic numerals;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a translation into English or French of any words in any other language that are contained in the trademark;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if the trademark consists in whole or in part of a three-dimensional shape, a hologram, a moving image, a mode of packaging goods, a sound, a scent, a taste, a texture or the positioning of a sign, a statement to that effect;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if colour is claimed as a feature of the trademark, a statement to that effect, along with the name of each colour claimed and an indication of the principal parts of the trademark that are in that colour;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: if the trademark consists exclusively of a single colour or a combination of colours without delineated contours, a statement to that effect, along with the name of each colour; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: if the trademark is a certification mark, a statement to that effect.

Subsection.Text: A person that files an application for the registration of a trademark, other than a Protocol application as defined in section 96 or a divisional application, must pay the applicable fee set out in item 7 of the schedule.
A person that files a divisional application that does not stem from a Protocol application as defined in section 96 must pay the applicable fee set out in item 7 of the schedule for

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case that the corresponding original application is itself a divisional application,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if the filed divisional application stems from a series of divisional applications, the original application from which the series stems, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the filed divisional application does not stem from a series of divisional applications, the original application from which the corresponding original application stems; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, the corresponding original application.

Subsection.Text: If all or part of the applicable fee set out in item 7 of the schedule is paid in respect of an application, the applicable fee referred to in that item, or part of it, as the case may be, is deemed to have been paid for

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: when that application is itself a divisional application,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case that it stems from a series of divisional applications, the original application from which stems the series and every divisional application that stems from that original application, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case that it does not stem from a series of divisional applications, its corresponding original application and every divisional application that stems from it; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: when that application is not itself a divisional application, every divisional application that stems from it.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of paragraph 33(1)(f) of the Act, the prescribed fees are those fees set out in subparagraphs 7(a)(i) and (b)(i) of the schedule to these Regulations.
For the purpose of paragraph 34(1)(b) of the Act, a request for priority must be filed within six months after the filing date of the application on which the request is based.
For the purpose of subsection 34(4) of the Act, a request for priority may be withdrawn by filing a request to that effect before the application is advertised under subsection 37(1) of the Act.

Section.Text: For the purpose of section 36 of the Act, the time within which a default in the prosecution of an application may be remedied is two months after the date of the notice of the default.

Heading.TitleText: Amendment of Application for Registration of a Trademark

Subsection.Text: An application for the registration of a trademark may be amended before the trademark is registered.
Despite subsection (1), the application must not be amended

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to change the identity of the applicant, unless the change results from the recording of a transfer of the application by the Registrar or, in the case of an application other than a Protocol application as defined in section 96, to correct an error in the applicant’s identification;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to change the representation or description of the trademark, unless the application has not been advertised under subsection 37(1) of the Act and the trademark remains substantially the same;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: to broaden the scope of the statement of the goods or services contained in the application beyond the scope of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: that statement on the filing date of the application, determined without taking into account section 34 of the Act or subsection 106(2) of these Regulations,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the narrower of that statement as advertised under subsection 37(1) of the Act and that statement as amended after that advertisement, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a Protocol application as defined in section 96, the list of goods or services, in respect of Canada, contained — at the time of the amendment, if it were made — in the international registration on which the application is based;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: to add an indication that it is a divisional application;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: to add or delete a statement referred to in paragraph 31(b) of the Act or paragraph 31(e), (f) or (g) of these Regulations, unless the application has not been advertised under subsection 37(1) of the Act and the trademark remains substantially the same; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: after the application is advertised under subsection 37(1) of the Act, to add or delete a statement referred to in paragraph 31(h) of these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (2), an amendment referred to in that subsection may be made in accordance with section 107, 111, 114 or 117.

Heading.TitleText: Transfer of Application for Registration of a Trademark

Section.Text: A person that requests the recording under subsection 48(3) of the Act of the transfer of an application for the registration of a trademark must pay the fee set out in item 8 of the schedule to these Regulations.

The Registrar must not record the transfer of an application for the registration of a trademark under subsection 48(3) of the Act unless the Registrar has been provided with the transferee’s name and postal address.

If the transfer to a person of an application for the registration of a trademark is, under subsection 48(3) of the Act or section 146 of these Regulations, recorded in respect of at least one but not all of the goods or services specified in the initial application,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that person is deemed to be the applicant in respect of a separate application;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the separate application is deemed to have the same filing date as that initial application; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any action taken, before the day on which the transfer is recorded, in relation to the initial application is deemed to have been taken in relation to that separate application.

Section.MarginalNote: Manner of identifying corresponding original application
Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 39(2) of the Act, the corresponding original application must be identified in a divisional application by means of its application number, if known.

Any action taken in respect of the corresponding original application, on or before the day on which the divisional application is filed, is deemed to be an action taken in respect of the divisional application, except

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an amendment of the statement of the goods or services contained in the original application; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the payment of the applicable fee set out in item 7 of the schedule to these Regulations.

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 37(1) of the Act, an application is advertised by publishing on the website of the Canadian Intellectual Property Office

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the application number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and postal address of the applicant and of the applicant’s trademark agent, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any representation or description of the trademark contained in the application;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if the trademark is in standard characters, a note to that effect;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if the trademark is a certification mark, a note to that effect;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the filing date of the application;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: if the applicant filed a request for priority in accordance with paragraph 34(1)(b) of the Act, the filing date and country or office of filing of the application on which the request for priority is based;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the statement of the goods or services in association with which the trademark is used or proposed to be used, grouped according to the classes of the Nice Classification, each group being preceded by the number of the class of the Nice Classification to which that group of goods or services belongs and presented in the order of the classes of the Nice Classification;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: any disclaimer made under section 35 of the Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: if the Registrar has restricted the registration to a defined territorial area in Canada under subsection 32(2) of the Act, a note to that effect.

Heading.TitleText: Opposition Proceeding Under Section 38 of Act

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 38(1) of the Act, the fee to be paid for filing a statement of opposition is that set out in item 9 of the schedule to these Regulations.
A person that corresponds with the Registrar in respect of an opposition proceeding must clearly indicate that the correspondence relates to that proceeding.

A party to an opposition proceeding that, on a given day, after the Registrar has forwarded a copy of the statement of opposition to the applicant under subsection 38(5) of the Act, provides to the Registrar a document, other than a document that they are otherwise required to serve, that relates to that proceeding must, on that day, forward a copy of it to the other party.

Unless they have appointed a trademark agent, an applicant may in their counter statement under subsection 38(7) of the Act set out, or may file with the Registrar and serve on the opponent a separate notice setting out, the name and address in Canada of a person on whom or a firm on which service of any document in respect of the opposition may be made with the same effect as if it had been served on the applicant.

Subsection.Text: Service of a document in respect of an opposition proceeding must be effected

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: by personal service in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: by registered mail to an address in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: by courier to an address in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: by the sending of a notice to the other party advising that the document to be served has been filed with or provided to the Registrar, if the party seeking to effect service does not have the information necessary to serve the other party in accordance with any of paragraphs (a) to (c); or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in any manner that is agreed to by the parties.

Subsection.Text: If a party to be served appoints a trademark agent in respect of an opposition proceeding,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that agent is deemed to replace any person or firm set out in a statement of opposition, counter statement or notice as a person on whom or a firm on which service of any document in respect of the opposition may be made with the same effect as if it had been served on the party directly; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: service must be effected on that agent unless the parties agree otherwise.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (4) to (7) and (10), service is effective on the day on which the document is delivered.
Service by registered mail is effective on the day on which the document is mailed.
Service by courier is effective on the day on which the document is provided to the courier.
Service by an electronic means is effective on the day on which the document is transmitted.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Exception — service by sending of notice
Subsection.Text: Service by the sending of a notice under paragraph (1)(d) is effective on the day on which the notice is sent.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Notice of manner and date of service
Subsection.Text: The party effecting service must notify the Registrar of the manner of service and the effective date of service.

A party that serves a document must, on request of the Registrar, provide proof of service within one month after the date of the request. If proof of service is not provided within that month, the document is deemed not to have been served.

Service of a document other than in accordance with subsection (1) is nonetheless valid if the Registrar determines that the document has been provided to the party being served and informs the parties of that determination. The service is effective on the day on which the document was provided to the party being served.

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 38(7) of the Act, the time is two months.

Subsection.Text: No amendment to a statement of opposition or counter statement may be made except with leave of the Registrar on terms that the Registrar considers to be appropriate.
The Registrar must grant leave under subsection (1) if it is in the interests of justice to do so.

Section.Text: Evidence in respect of an opposition proceeding, other than evidence referred to in subsection 56(3) of these Regulations, is to be submitted to the Registrar by way of affidavit or statutory declaration. However, if the evidence consists of a document or extract from a document that is in the official custody of the Registrar, it may be submitted by way of a certified copy referred to in section 54 of the Act.

Subsection.Text: The opponent may submit evidence referred to in subsection 38(8) of the Act to the Registrar within a period of four months after the day on which the applicant’s service on the opponent of a copy of the counter statement is effective.
For the purpose of subsection 38(9) of the Act, the time within which the opponent must serve that evidence on the applicant is during that four-month period.

If the opponent does not wish to submit evidence referred to in subsection 38(8) of the Act, they may submit a statement to that effect to the Registrar within the four-month period referred to in subsection (1) of this section and, if so, they must serve it on the applicant within that period.

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 38(10) of the Act, the circumstances under which the opponent’s not submitting and serving evidence referred to in subsection 38(8) of the Act or a statement that the opponent does not wish to submit evidence results in their opposition being deemed to have been withdrawn are that neither that evidence nor that statement has been submitted and served by the opponent by the end of the four-month period referred to in section 50 of these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: The applicant may submit evidence referred to in subsection 38(8) of the Act to the Registrar within a period of four months after the day on which the opponent’s service under section 50 of these Regulations is effective.
For the purpose of subsection 38(9) of the Act, the time within which the applicant must serve that evidence on the opponent is during that four-month period.

If the applicant does not wish to submit evidence referred to in subsection 38(8) of the Act, they may submit a statement to that effect to the Registrar within the four-month period referred to in subsection (1) of this section and, if so, they must serve it on the opponent within that period.

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 38(11) of the Act, the circumstances under which the applicant’s not submitting and serving evidence referred to in subsection 38(8) of the Act or a statement that the applicant does not wish to submit evidence results in their application being deemed to have been abandoned are that neither that evidence nor that statement has been submitted and served by the applicant by the end of the four-month period referred to in section 52 of these Regulations.

Within one month after the day on which the service on the opponent under section 52 is effective, the opponent may submit to the Registrar reply evidence and, if so, they must serve it on the applicant within that one-month period.

Subsection.Text: A party may submit additional evidence with leave of the Registrar on terms that the Registrar considers to be appropriate.
The Registrar must grant leave under subsection (1) if it is in the interests of justice to do so.

On the application of a party made before the Registrar gives notice in accordance with subsection 57(1), the Registrar must order the cross-examination under oath or solemn affirmation, within the period specified by the Registrar, of any affiant or declarant on an affidavit or statutory declaration that has been submitted to the Registrar as evidence in the opposition proceeding.
The cross-examination is to be conducted as agreed to by the parties or, in the absence of an agreement, as specified by the Registrar.
Within the period specified by the Registrar for conducting the cross-examination,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the party that conducted the cross-examination must submit to the Registrar and serve on the other party the transcript of the cross-examination and the exhibits to the cross-examination; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the party that was cross-examined must submit to the Registrar and serve on the other party any information, document or material that they undertook to provide in the course of the cross-examination.

Subsection.Text: An affidavit or statutory declaration is not to be part of the evidence if the affiant or declarant declines or fails to attend for cross-examination.
After all evidence has been filed, the Registrar must give the parties notice that they may submit written representations to the Registrar.
The opponent may submit written representations to the Registrar within a period of two months after the date of that notice.
For the purpose of subsection 38(9) of the Act, the time within which the opponent must serve their written representations on the applicant is during that two-month period.

If the opponent does not wish to submit written representations, they may submit a statement to that effect to the Registrar within the two-month period referred to in subsection (2) and, if so, they must serve it on the applicant within that period.
The applicant may submit written representations to the Registrar within the following period:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if service referred to in subsection (3) or (4), as the case may be, is effective within the two-month period referred to in subsection (2), two months after the day on which that service is effective; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, two months after the end of the two-month period referred to in subsection (2).

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection 38(9) of the Act, the time within which the applicant must serve their written representations on the opponent is during the two-month period determined under subsection (5) of this section for their submission of written representations.

If the applicant does not wish to submit written representations, they may submit a statement to that effect to the Registrar within the two-month period determined under subsection (5) for their submission of written representations and, if so, they must serve it on the opponent within that period.

Within one month after the day on which the applicant’s service on the opponent of written representations or of a statement that the applicant does not wish to make written representations is effective — or, if no such service is effective within the two-month period determined under subsection 57(5) for their submission of written representations, within one month after the end of that two-month period — a party that wishes to make representations to the Registrar at a hearing must file with the Registrar a request that indicates

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: whether they intend to make representations in English or French and whether they will require simultaneous interpretation if the other party makes representations in the other official language; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: whether they wish to make representations in person, by telephone, by video conference or by another means of communication offered by the Registrar, and that sets out any information necessary to permit the use of the chosen means of communication.

Subsection.Text: A party may make representations at the hearing only if they file a request in accordance with subsection (1).

If a party, at least one month before the date of the hearing, notifies the Registrar of changes to be made in respect of any of the information provided under subsection (1), the Registrar must modify the administrative arrangements for the hearing accordingly.
The Registrar may, on request, award costs against a party to an opposition proceeding in the following amounts:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where the party’s application for the registration of a trademark is refused on the ground that it was filed in bad faith with respect to one or more of the goods or services, an amount that is ten times the fee set out in item 9 of the schedule to these Regulations for filing a statement of opposition under subsection 38(1) of the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where the party files a divisional application on or after the day on which the original application is advertised under subsection 37(1) of the Act and the costs are awarded in respect of the divisional application, an amount that is two times the fee set out in item 9 of the schedule to these Regulations for filing a statement of opposition under subsection 38(1) of the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where the party withdraws a request for a hearing less than 14 days before the day on which the hearing is scheduled to take place, an amount that is two times the fee set out in item 9 of the schedule to these Regulations for filing a statement of opposition under subsection 38(1) of the Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where the party engages in unreasonable conduct that causes undue delay or expense in the proceeding, an amount that is five times the fee set out in item 9 of the schedule to these Regulations for filing a statement of opposition under subsection 38(1) of the Act.

Subsection.Text: The Registrar must not award costs if the opposition proceeding is ended before the final decision is issued.
Subsection (1) does not apply if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the circumstances referred to in paragraph (1)(a), the ground referred to in that paragraph is included in a statement of opposition that is filed or amended before the day on which this section comes into force;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the circumstances referred to in paragraph (1)(b), the divisional application is filed before the day on which this section comes into force;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the circumstances referred to in paragraph (1)(c), the hearing is scheduled to take place on or before the day on which this section comes into force or within 14 days after that day; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the circumstances referred to in paragraph (1)(d), the unreasonable conduct occurs before the day on which this section comes into force.

Subsection.Text: A request by a party that costs be awarded must be filed using the online service that is designated by the Registrar as being accepted for that purpose and must specify the reasons for the request and the circumstances for which costs are sought.
The request for costs must be filed

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where a party has filed a request for a hearing under subsection 58(1), within 14 days after the day on which the hearing ends or within 14 days after the day on which the Registrar notifies the parties that the hearing has been cancelled; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, within 14 days after the end of the one-month period for filing a request for a hearing under subsection 58(1).

Section.Text: The Registrar must give the other party notice of the request for costs and an opportunity to make written representations, which must, within 14 days after the day on which the notice is given, be made using the online service that is designated by the Registrar as being accepted for that purpose.
For the purpose of paragraph 26(2)(f) of the Act, the following are other particulars that are required to be entered on the register:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the registration number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and postal address of the registered owner on the date of registration;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any representation or description of the trademark that is contained in the application for the registration of the trademark;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if the trademark is in standard characters, a note to that effect;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if the trademark is a certification mark, a note to that effect; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if the Registrar has restricted the registration to a defined territorial area in Canada under subsection 32(2) of the Act, a note to that effect.

Section.MarginalNote: Fee for extending statement of goods or services
Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 41(1) of the Act, the fee to be paid by a registered owner that makes an application to extend the statement of goods or services in respect of which a trademark is registered is that set out in item 10 of the schedule to these Regulations.
The Registrar may merge registrations under paragraph 41(1)(f) of the Act only if the trademarks to which the registrations apply are the same and have the same registered owner.

Section.MarginalNote: Fee for the giving of notice
Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 44(1) of the Act, the fee to be paid by a person that requests that a notice be given under that subsection is that set out in item 11 of the schedule to these Regulations.

Section.MarginalNote: Requested statement of goods or services — timing
Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 44.1(1) of the Act, the time within which a registered owner must furnish the Registrar with a statement of goods and services grouped in the manner described in subsection 30(3) of the Act is six months after the date of the notice that was given to them.
A person that requests the registration of the transfer of a registered trademark under subsection 48(4) of the Act must pay the fee set out in item 12 of the schedule to these Regulations.
The Registrar must not register the transfer of a registered trademark under subsection 48(4) of the Act unless the Registrar has been provided with the transferee’s name and postal address.

If the transfer to a person of a registered trademark is, under subsection 48(4) of the Act or section 146 of these Regulations, registered in respect of at least one but not all of the goods or services that are specified in the initial registration, that person is deemed to be the registered owner of a separate registration that is deemed to have the same registration date as that initial registration.

For the purpose of subsection 45(1) of the Act, the fee to be paid by a person that requests that a notice be given under that subsection is that set out in item 13 of the schedule to these Regulations.
A person that corresponds with the Registrar in respect of a proceeding under section 45 of the Act must clearly indicate that the correspondence relates to that proceeding.

A party to a proceeding under section 45 of the Act that, on a given day after the Registrar has given notice under subsection 45(1) of the Act, provides to the Registrar a document, other than a document that they are otherwise required to serve, that relates to that proceeding must, on that day, forward a copy of it to any other party.

A party to a proceeding under section 45 of the Act may file with the Registrar and serve on any other party to the proceeding a notice setting out the name and address in Canada of a person on whom or a firm on which service of any document in respect of the proceeding may be made with the same effect as if it had been served on them.

Subsection.Text: Service of a document in respect of a proceeding under section 45 of the Act must be effected

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: by personal service in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: by registered mail to an address in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: by courier to an address in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: by the sending of a notice to the other party advising that the document to be served has been filed with or submitted to the Registrar, if the party seeking to effect service does not have the information necessary to serve the other party in accordance with any of paragraphs (a) to (c); or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in any manner that is agreed to by the parties.

Subsection.Text: Despite section 70, if a party to be served appoints a trademark agent in respect of a proceeding under section 45 of the Act, service must be effected on that agent unless the parties agree otherwise.
Subject to subsections (4) to (7) and (10), service is effective on the day on which the document is delivered.
Service by registered mail is effective on the day on which the document is mailed.
Service by courier is effective on the day on which the document is provided to the courier.
Service by an electronic means is effective on the day on which the document is transmitted.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Exception — service by sending of notice
Subsection.Text: Service by the sending of a notice under paragraph (1)(d) is effective on the day on which the notice is sent.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Notice of manner and date of service
Subsection.Text: The party effecting service must notify the Registrar of the manner of service and the effective date of service.

A party that serves a document must, on request of the Registrar, provide proof of service within one month after the date of the request. If proof of service is not provided within that month, the document is deemed not to have been served.

Service of a document other than in accordance with subsection (1) is nonetheless valid if the Registrar determines that the document has been provided to the party being served and informs the parties of that determination. The service is effective on the day on which the document was provided to the party being served.

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 45(2.1) of the Act, the time within which the registered owner of the trademark must serve their evidence on the person at whose request the notice was given is the three-month period referred to in subsection 45(1) of the Act.

Subsection.Text: After the registered owner has furnished an affidavit or statutory declaration to the Registrar in response to a notice given under subsection 45(1) of the Act, the Registrar must give the parties notice that they may submit written representations to the Registrar.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Timing if notice given at Registrar’s initiative
Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection 45(2) of the Act, if the notice referred to in subsection 45(1) of the Act was given on the Registrar’s own initiative, the time within which the registered owner may submit written representations to the Registrar is two months after the date of the notice given under subsection (1) of this section.

If the registered owner does not wish to submit written representations in respect of a notice referred to in subsection 45(1) of the Act that was given on the Registrar’s own initiative, they may submit a statement to that effect to the Registrar within the two-month period referred to in subsection (2) of this section.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Timing if notice given on request
Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsections 45(2) and (2.1) of the Act, if the notice referred to in subsection 45(1) of the Act was given at the request of a person, the time within which that person may submit written representations to the Registrar and must serve those representations on the registered owner is two months after the date of the notice given under subsection (1) of this section.

If that person does not wish to submit written representations, they may submit a statement to that effect to the Registrar within the two-month period referred to in subsection (4) and, if so, they must serve it on the registered owner within that period.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Timing of registered owner’s written representations
Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsections 45(2) and (2.1) of the Act, if the notice referred to in subsection 45(1) of the Act was given at the request of a person, the time within which the registered owner may submit written representations to the Registrar and must serve those representations on that person is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case that a service referred to in subsection (4) or (5) of this section, as the case may be, is effective within the two-month period referred to in that subsection (4), two months after the day on which that service is effective; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, two months after the end of the two-month period referred to in that subsection (4).

Subsection.Text: If the registered owner does not wish to submit written representations in respect of a notice referred to in subsection (6), they may submit a statement to that effect to the Registrar within the two-month period determined under subsection (6) for their submission of written representations and, if so, they must serve it on the person requesting the notice within that period.
Every party that wishes to make representations to the Registrar at a hearing must file with the Registrar a request that indicates

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: whether the party intends to make representations in English or French and whether they will require simultaneous interpretation if another party makes representations in the other official language; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: whether the party wishes to make representations in person, by telephone, by video conference or by another means of communication offered by the Registrar and that sets out any information necessary to permit the use of the chosen means of communication.

Subsection.Text: The request must be filed within the following period:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the notice referred to in subsection 45(1) of the Act was given on the Registrar’s own initiative, one month after the day on which the registered owner submits to the Registrar written representations or a statement that they do not wish to make written representations or, if no such submission is made within the two-month period referred to in subsection 73(2) of these Regulations, one month after the end of that two-month period; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the notice referred to in subsection 45(1) of the Act was given at the request of a person, one month after the day on which the registered owner’s service of written representations or of a statement that they do not wish to make written representations is effective or, if no such service is effective within the two-month period determined under 73(6) of these Regulations for their submission of written representations, one month after the end of that two-month period.

Subsection.Text: A party may make representations at the hearing only if they file a request in accordance with this section.

If a party, at least one month before the date of the hearing, notifies the Registrar of changes to be made in respect of any of the information provided under subsection (1), the Registrar must modify the administrative arrangements for the hearing accordingly.
The Registrar may, on request, award costs against a party to a proceeding under section 45 of the Act in the following amounts:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where the party withdraws a request for a hearing less than 14 days before the day on which the hearing is scheduled to take place, an amount that is two times the fee set out in item 13 of the schedule to these Regulations for a request that a notice be given under subsection 45(1) of the Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where the party engages in unreasonable conduct that causes undue delay or expense in the proceeding, an amount that is five times the fee set out in item 13 of the schedule to these Regulations for a request that a notice be given under subsection 45(1) of the Act.

Subsection.Text: The Registrar must not award costs if the proceeding is ended before the final decision is issued.
Subsection (1) does not apply if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the circumstances referred to in paragraph (1)(a), the hearing is scheduled to take place on or before the day on which this section comes into force or within 14 days after that day; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the circumstances referred to in paragraph (1)(b), the unreasonable conduct occurs before the day on which this section comes into force.

Subsection.Text: A request by a party that costs be awarded must be filed using the online service that is designated by the Registrar as being accepted for that purpose and must specify the reasons for the request and the circumstances for which costs are sought.
The request for costs must be filed

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where a party has filed a request for a hearing under subsection 74(1), within 14 days after the day on which the hearing ends or within 14 days after the day on which the Registrar notifies the parties that the hearing has been cancelled; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, within 14 days after the end of the one-month period for filing a request for a hearing under subsection 74(1).

Section.Text: The Registrar must give the other party notice of the request for costs and an opportunity to make written representations, which must, within 14 days after the day on which the notice is given, be made using the online service that is designated by the Registrar as being accepted for that purpose.
For the purpose of section 46 of the Act, the renewal fee to be paid is that set out in item 14 of the schedule to these Regulations.
For the purpose of section 46 of the Act, the period within which the renewal fee is to be paid

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: begins on the day that is six months before the end of the initial period or the renewal period, as the case may be, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ends at the later of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the end of the six-month period that begins after the end of that initial or renewal period, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if a notice is sent under subsection 46(2) of the Act, the end of the two-month period that begins after the date of that notice.

Section.Text: For the purpose of a renewal under section 46 of the Act, the deemed day of registration in respect of a registration of a trademark that results from the merger of registrations under paragraph 41(1)(f) of the Act is the day that is 10 years before the earliest day, after the day of the merger, on which the initial period or the renewal period, as the case may be, in respect of any of the registrations being merged would have expired, had the merger not occurred.

Heading.TitleText: Objection Proceeding Under Section 11.13 of Act

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 11.13(1) of the Act, the fee to be paid for filing a statement of objection is that set out in item 15 of the schedule to these Regulations.
A person that corresponds with the Registrar in respect of an objection proceeding must clearly indicate that the correspondence relates to that proceeding.

A party to an objection proceeding that, on a given day after a statement of objection has been filed with the Registrar under subsection 11.13(1) of the Act, provides to the Registrar a document, other than a document that they are otherwise required to serve on another party, that relates to that proceeding must, on that day, forward a copy of it to the other party.

Subsection.Text: Service of a document in respect of an objection proceeding must be effected

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: by personal service in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: by registered mail to an address in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: by courier to an address in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: by the sending of a notice to the other party advising that the document to be served has been filed with or submitted to the Registrar, if the party seeking to effect service does not have the information necessary to serve the other party in accordance with any of paragraphs (a) to (c); or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in any manner that is agreed to by the parties.

Subsection.Text: If a party to be served appoints a trademark agent in respect of an objection proceeding,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that agent is deemed, in respect of any party that has been served with notice of the appointment, to replace any person or firm set out in a statement by the Minister or a statement of objection as a person on whom or a firm on which service of any document may be made with the same effect as if it had been served on the party directly; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: service must be effected on that agent unless the parties agree otherwise.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (4) to (7) and (10), service is effective on the day on which the document is delivered.
Service by registered mail is effective on the day on which the document is mailed.
Service by courier is effective on the day on which the document is provided to the courier.
Service by an electronic means is effective on the day on which the document is transmitted.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Exception — service by sending of notice
Subsection.Text: Service by the sending of a notice under paragraph (1)(d) is effective on the day on which the notice is sent.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Notice of manner and date of service
Subsection.Text: The party effecting service must notify the Registrar of the manner of service and the effective date of service.

A party that serves a document must, on request of the Registrar, provide proof of service within one month after the date of the request. If proof of service is not provided within that month, the document is deemed not to have been served.

Service of a document other than in accordance with subsection (1) is nonetheless valid if the Registrar determines that the document has been provided to the party being served and informs the parties of that determination. The service is effective on the day on which the document was provided to the party being served.
No amendment to a statement of objection or counter statement may be made except with leave of the Registrar on terms that the Registrar considers to be appropriate.
The Registrar must grant leave under subsection (1) if it is in the interests of justice to do so.

Section.Text: Evidence in respect of an objection proceeding, other than evidence referred to in subsection 91(3) of these Regulations, is to be submitted to the Registrar by way of affidavit or statutory declaration. However, if the evidence consists of a document or extract from a document that is in the official custody of the Registrar, it may be submitted by way of a certified copy referred to in section 54 of the Act.

Subsection.Text: The objector may submit evidence referred to in subsection 11.13(5) of the Act to the Registrar within a period of four months after the day on which the responsible authority’s service on the objector of a copy of the counter statement is effective.
For the purpose of subsection 11.13(5.1) of the Act, the time within which the objector must serve that evidence on the responsible authority is during that four-month period.

If the objector does not wish to submit evidence, they may submit a statement to that effect to the Registrar within the four-month period referred to in subsection (1) and, if so, they must serve it on the responsible authority within that period.

Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 11.13(6) of the Act, the circumstances under which the objector’s not submitting and serving evidence or a statement referred to in that subsection results in their objection being deemed to have been withdrawn are that neither that evidence nor that statement has been submitted and served by the objector by the end of the four-month period referred to in section 84 of these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: The responsible authority may submit evidence referred to in subsection 11.13(5) of the Act to the Registrar within a period of four months after the day on which the objector’s service under section 84 of these Regulations is effective.
For the purpose of subsection 11.13(5.1) of the Act, the time within which the responsible authority must serve that evidence on the objector is during that four-month period.

If the responsible authority does not wish to submit evidence, they may submit a statement to that effect to the Registrar within the four-month period referred to in subsection (1) and, if so, they must serve it on the objector within that period.

Section.MarginalNote: Non-application of subsection 11.13(5) of Act — circumstances
Section.Text: For the purpose of paragraph 11.13(5)(a) of the Act, the circumstances under which the responsible authority’s not submitting evidence or a statement that they do not wish to submit evidence results in the loss of the opportunity to submit evidence and to make representations to the Registrar are that neither that evidence nor that statement has been submitted and served by the responsible authority by the end of the four-month period referred to in section 86 of these Regulations.

Section.MarginalNote: Circumstances — indication or translation not entered on list
Section.Text: For the purpose of subsection 11.13(6.1) of the Act, the circumstances under which the responsible authority’s not submitting and serving evidence or a statement that they do not wish to submit evidence results in the indication or the translation not being entered on the list are that neither that evidence nor that statement has been submitted and served by the responsible authority by the end of the four-month period referred to in section 86 of these Regulations.

Within one month after the day on which the service on the objector under section 86 is effective, the objector may submit to the Registrar reply evidence and, if so, they must serve it on the responsible authority within that one-month period.

Subsection.Text: A party may submit additional evidence with leave of the Registrar on terms that the Registrar considers to be appropriate.
The Registrar must grant leave under subsection (1) if it is in the interests of justice to do so.

On the application of a party made before the Registrar gives notice in accordance with subsection 92(1), the Registrar must order the cross-examination under oath or solemn affirmation, within the period specified by the Registrar, of any affiant or declarant on an affidavit or statutory declaration that has been submitted to the Registrar as evidence in the objection proceeding.
The cross-examination is to be conducted as agreed to by the parties or, in the absence of an agreement, as specified by the Registrar.
Within the period specified by the Registrar for conducting the cross-examination,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the party that conducted the cross-examination must submit to the Registrar and serve on the other party the transcript of the cross-examination and exhibits to the cross-examination; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the party that was cross-examined must submit to the Registrar and serve on the other party any information, document or material that they undertook to provide in the course of the cross-examination.

Subsection.Text: An affidavit or statutory declaration is not to be part of the evidence if an affiant or declarant declines or fails to attend for cross-examination.
After all evidence has been filed, the Registrar must give the parties notice that they may submit written representations to the Registrar.
The objector may submit written representations to the Registrar within a period of two months after the date of that notice.
For the purpose of subsection 11.13(5.1) of the Act, the time within which the objector must serve their written representations on the responsible authority is during that two-month period.

If the objector does not wish to submit written representations, they may submit a statement to that effect to the Registrar within the two-month period referred to in subsection (2) and, if so, they must serve it on the responsible authority within that period.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Timing of responsible authority’s written representations
Subsection.Text: The responsible authority may submit written representations to the Registrar within the following period:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if service referred to in subsection (3) or (4), as the case may be, is effective within the two-month period referred to in that subsection, two months after the day on which that service is effective; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, two months after the end of the two-month period referred to in subsection (2).

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection 11.13(5.1) of the Act, the time within which the responsible authority must serve their written representations on the objector is during the two-month period determined under subsection (5) of this section for their submission of written representations.

If the responsible authority does not wish to submit written representations, they may submit a statement to that effect to the Registrar within the two-month period determined under subsection (5) for their submission of written representations and, if so, they must serve it on the objector within that period.

Within one month after the day on which the responsible authority’s service on the objector of written representations or of a statement that the responsible authority does not wish to make written representations is effective — or, if no such service is effective within the two-month period determined under subsection 92(5) for their submission of written representations, within one month after the end of that two-month period — a party that wishes to make representations to the Registrar at a hearing must file with the Registrar a request that indicates

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: whether they intend to make representations in English or French and whether they will require simultaneous interpretation if the other party makes representations in the other official language; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: whether they wish to make representations in person, by telephone, by video conference or by another means of communication offered by the Registrar, and that sets out any information necessary to permit the use of the chosen means of communication.

Subsection.Text: A party may make representations at the hearing only if they file a request in accordance with subsection (1).

If a party, at least one month before the date of the hearing, notifies the Registrar of changes to be made in respect of any of the information provided under subsection (1), the Registrar must modify the administrative arrangements for the hearing accordingly.
The Registrar may, on request, award costs against a party to an objection proceeding in the following amounts:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where the party withdraws a request for a hearing less than 14 days before the day on which the hearing is scheduled to take place, an amount that is two times the fee set out in item 15 of the schedule to these Regulations for filing a statement of objection under subsection 11.13(1) of the Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where the party engages in unreasonable conduct that causes undue delay or expense in the proceeding, an amount that is five times the fee set out in item 15 of the schedule to these Regulations for filing a statement of objection under subsection 11.13(1) of the Act.

Subsection.Text: The Registrar must not award costs if the objection proceeding is ended before the final decision is issued.
Subsection (1) does not apply if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the circumstances referred to in paragraph (1)(a), the hearing is scheduled to take place on or before the day on which this section comes into force or within 14 days after that day; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the circumstances referred to in paragraph (1)(b), the unreasonable conduct occurs before the day on which this section comes into force.

Subsection.Text: A request by a party that costs be awarded must be filed using the online service that is designated by the Registrar as being accepted for that purpose and must specify the reasons for the request and the circumstances for which costs are sought.
The request for costs must be filed

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where a party has filed a request for a hearing under subsection 93(1), within 14 days after the day on which the hearing ends or within 14 days after the day on which the Registrar notifies the parties that the hearing has been cancelled; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, within 14 days after the end of the one-month period for filing a request for a hearing under subsection 93(1).

Section.Text: The Registrar must give the other party notice of the request for costs and an opportunity to make written representations, which must, within 14 days after the day on which the notice is given, be made using the online service that is designated by the Registrar as being accepted for that purpose.

Subsection.Text: A person that requests a certified copy of a document that is in the Registrar’s possession must pay the fee set out in item 16 or 17 of the schedule, as applicable.
Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of a certified copy that is transmitted under section 60 of the Act or rule 318 of the Federal Courts Rules, including as modified by rule 350 of those Rules.

Section.Text: A person that requests a non-certified copy of a document that is in the Registrar’s possession must pay the fee set out in item 18 or 19 of the schedule, as applicable.

Heading.TitleText: Confidentiality Order Under Section 45.1 of Act

Subsection.Text: A party to a proceeding under section 11.13, 38 or 45 of the Act who makes a request to the Registrar under subsection 45.1(1) of the Act for an order that evidence be kept confidential must submit the following information to the Registrar:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the evidence that the party wishes to be kept confidential;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that the evidence has not been made public;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the reasons why the evidence should be kept confidential;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an indication of whether the other party consents to the request; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any other information that the Registrar requires in order to make a decision with respect to the request.

Subsection.Text: In deciding whether to make a confidentiality order under subsection 45.1(4) of the Act, the Registrar must consider the public interest in open and accessible proceedings.
A party who submits information to the Registrar that is subject to a confidentiality order must ensure that the information is designated as confidential.

For greater certainty, at any time in the proceeding, the Registrar may, under subsection 45.1(4) of the Act, amend the confidentiality order if the Registrar considers it appropriate in the circumstances or revoke it if the Registrar is no longer satisfied that the evidence should be kept confidential.

Section.Text: The Registrar may, as the circumstances and considerations of fairness permit, make any order or give any direction that the Registrar considers appropriate to deal with a proceeding under section 11.13, 38 or 45 of the Act in an efficient and cost-effective manner.

Subsection.Text: The Registrar may, at any time in a proceeding under section 11.13, 38 or 45 of the Act, designate the proceeding as a case-managed proceeding to which this section applies, subject to any terms that the Registrar considers appropriate.
In determining whether to designate a proceeding as a case-managed proceeding, the Registrar must consider all the surrounding circumstances, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the extent of intervention by the Registrar that the proceeding is likely to require for matters to be dealt with in an efficient and cost-effective manner;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the nature and extent of evidence;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the complexity of the proceeding;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: whether the parties are represented;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the number of related files; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: whether substantial delay has occurred or is anticipated to occur in the conduct of the proceeding.

Subsection.Text: The Registrar may fix the time by which or the manner in which any step in a case-managed proceeding is to be completed, despite any time or manner that is provided for under the Act with respect to the proceeding.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Part.

Definition.Text: basic application means an application for the registration of a trademark that has been filed under subsection 30(1) of the Act and that constitutes the basis for an application for international registration, but does not include a Protocol application. (demande de base)

basic registration means a registration of a trademark that is on the register and that constitutes the basis for an application for international registration, but does not include a Protocol registration. (enregistrement de base)

Common Regulations means the Common Regulations under the Madrid Agreement Concerning the International Registration of Marks and the Protocol Relating to that Agreement, as modified from time to time. (Règlement d’exécution commun)
contracting party means any state or intergovernmental organization that is a party to the Protocol. (partie contractante)
date of international registration means the date borne by an international registration under Rule 15 of the Common Regulations. (date de l’enregistrement international)

date of notification of territorial extension means the day on which the International Bureau notifies the Registrar of a request made under Article 3ter(1) or (2) of the Protocol. (date de la notification d’extension territoriale)
holder means the person in whose name an international registration is recorded in the International Register. (titulaire)
opposition period means the two-month period referred to in subsection 38(1) of the Act. (délai d’opposition)

Protocol means the Protocol Relating to the Madrid Agreement Concerning the International Registration of Marks, adopted at Madrid on June 27, 1989, including any amendments, modifications and revisions made from time to time to which Canada is a party. (Protocole)
Protocol application means an application referred to in subsection 103(1) or (2) or a divisional application referred to in subsection 124(1). (demande prévue au Protocole)
Protocol registration means the registration of a trademark under subsection 132(1). (enregistrement prévu au Protocole)

Subsection.Text: Section 66 of the Act does not apply in respect of periods fixed by this Part, except

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the two-month period fixed by subsections 117(2) and (3) of these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the maximum four-month extension fixed by section 125 of these Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the three-month period fixed by section 147 of these Regulations.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Application of Rule 4(4) of Common Regulations
Subsection.Text: Rule 4(4) of the Common Regulations applies to all periods fixed by this Part other than those referred to in paragraphs (1)(a) to (c) of this section.

Heading.TitleText: Application for International Registration (Office of Registrar as Office of Origin)
